alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 6:01PM MDT until July 28 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL GRAND COUNTY... At 601 PM MDT, Thunderstorms had produced 0.5 to 1 inch of rain over the warned area. These have since moved out of the area, but localized flash flooding will still be possible as runoff continues over the East Troublesome burn scar. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hot Sulphur Springs. This includes the following additional locations... Stillwater Pass, Upper Willow Creek Valley, Middle Willow Creek Valley, Lower Willow Creek Valley, Drowsy Water Ranch, Elk Mountain, Remote East Troublesome Headwaters, East Troublesome Valley and Upper Corral Creek Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Heavy Rainfall may cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
